author: Kristina Peterson
title: House Effort to Override Trump Veto on National Emergency Measure Comes Up Short
description: House Democrats’ effort to override President Trump’s veto of a measure aimed at rolling back his emergency declaration was defeated in a 248-181 vote.

Magazine Sections Fashion Art & Design Travel Food Culture Search Search →                                 Share  Text  117                Politics       House Effort to Override Trump Veto on National Emergency Measure Comes Up Short  President’s veto of measure to terminate national emergency is upheld in 248-181 vote               At a press event in the Oval Office, President Trump used his first veto to strike down the congressional resolution designed to block his emergency declaration at the southern border. Photo: Getty       By   Kristina Peterson and   Kristina Peterson  The Wall Street Journal  Biography Kristina Peterson  @kristinapet  kristina.peterson@wsj.com     Natalie Andrews    Natalie Andrews  The Wall Street Journal  Biography Natalie Andrews  @nataliewsj  nataliew  natalie.andrews@wsj.com     Updated March 26, 2019 3:15 p.m. ET       WASHINGTON—House Democrats came up short Tuesday in an effort to override President Trump’s veto of a measure aimed at rolling back his declaration of a national emergency.  The 248-181 vote, which didn’t clear the two-thirds threshold, was the coda of a long struggle over funding a wall along the border with Mexico. Both the Democratic-led House and GOP-controlled Senate had previously passed a resolution rejecting Mr. Trump’s declaration of an emergency at the southern border, prompting him to issue his first veto earlier...
